intro: Hylodesmum laxum subsp. falfolium, commonly known as the coastal hylodesmum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its adaptability to coastal conditions makes it an important species in dune stabilization and ecological restoration efforts.
